verses.verse: God Accuses Israel (Isa 59.4; Jer 7.28; Hos 5.1, 4; 6.6; 12.2; Mic 6.2) Hear the word of the LORD, O people of Israel, for the LORD has an indictment against the inhabitants of the land. There is no faithfulness or loyalty and no knowledge of God in the land.
Swearing, lying, and murder, and stealing and adultery break out; bloodshed follows bloodshed.
(Jer 4.25, 28; Zeph 1.3) Therefore the land mourns, and all who live in it languish; together with the wild animals and the birds of the air, even the fish of the sea are perishing.
(Deut 17.12; Ezek 3.26) Yet let no one contend, and let none accuse, for with you is my contention, O priest. (Cn: Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Ezek 14.3, 7; Hos 2.2, 5; 5.5) You shall stumble by day; the prophet also shall stumble with you by night, and I will destroy your mother.

(v 1|HOS 4:1; Hos 2.13; 8.1, 12; Mal 2.7, 8) My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge! Because you have rejected knowledge, I reject you from being a priest to me; and since you have forgotten the law of your God, I also will forget your children.
(Hos 10.1; 13.6; Hab 2.16; Mal 2.9) The more they increased, the more they sinned against me; they changed (Tg Syr: MT I will change) their glory into shame.
They feed on the sin of my people; they are greedy for their iniquity.
(Isa 24.2; Jer 5.31; Hos 9.9) And it shall be like people, like priest; I will punish them for their ways and repay them for their deeds.
(Lev 26.26; Hos 7.14; 9.17; Mic 6.14) They shall eat but not be satisfied; they shall prostitute themselves but not multiply, because they have forsaken the LORD to devote themselves to
(Isa 28.7; Hos 5.4) prostitution. Wine and new wine take away the understanding.

The Idolatry of Israel (Jer 2.27; Hos 5.4; 9.1; Hab 2.19) My people consult a piece of wood, and their divining rod gives them oracles. For a spirit of prostitution has led them astray, and they have prostituted themselves, forsaking their God.

(Jer 3.6; Ezek 6.13; Hos 2.13; 11.2; Am 7.17; Rom 1.28) They sacrifice on the tops of the mountains and make offerings upon the hills, under oak, poplar, and terebinth because their shade is good. Therefore your daughters prostitute themselves, and your daughters-in-law commit adultery.

(vv 1, 6, 11|HOS 4:1611; Deut 23.17) I will not punish your daughters when they prostitute themselves nor your daughters-in-law when they commit adultery, for the men themselves go aside with prostitutes and sacrifice with female attendants; thus a people without understanding comes to ruin.
(1 Kings 12.28, 29; Am 4.4) Though you prostitute yourself, O Israel, do not let Judah become guilty. Do not enter into Gilgal or go up to Beth-aven, and do not swear, “As the LORD lives.”
(Ps 78.8; Isa 5.17; 7.25) Like a stubborn heifer, Israel is stubborn; can the LORD now feed them like a lamb in a broad pasture?
Ephraim is joined to idols— let him alone.
(vv 7, 14) When their drinking is ended, they indulge in sexual orgies; they love lewdness more than their glory. (Cn Compare Gk: Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Isa 1.29; Hos 12.1; 13.15) A wind has wrapped them (Heb her) in its wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their altars. (Gk Syr: Heb sacrifices)
